metadata.Title: CVE-2021-43541 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
When invoking protocol handlers for external protocols, a suppliedparameter URL containing spaces was not properly escaped. Thisvulnerability affects Thunderbird < 91.4.0, Firefox ESR < 91.4.0, andFirefox < 95.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-43541` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 95.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 95.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 95.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '95.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
